Package it.unimore.iot.health.api.datamanager.resources

Class HealthCheckResource

java.lang.Object
it.unimore.iot.health.api.datamanager.resources.HealthCheckResource
@Path("/api/iot/inventory/healthcheck") public class HealthCheckResource extends Object
HealthCheckResource class contains a series of methods necessary for the correct management of incoming requests by a client, in accordance with the CRUD manipulation of the healthcheck resource. Therefore, any request sent by a client related to the Healthcheck resource is processed here, and this is where all HTTP response codes come into play.
Author:
Christopher Zanoli, Undergraduate student - 270765@studenti.unimore.it

  • Method Details

    • getHealthChecks

      @GET @Path("/") @Timed @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getHealthChecks(@Context javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext req, @QueryParam("patientId") String patientId, @QueryParam("anomaly") String anomaly)
      This method allows managing and responding to a GET request from a client, who wants to obtain the list of registered healthcehks.
      Parameters:
      req - Dropwizard maps the incoming request into an object, which can be used within our method
      patientId - it is a String representing the UUID of a patient, as @QueryParam
      anomaly - it is a String representing a type of measurement of which to find anomalous healthchecks, as @QueryParam
      Returns:
      1. If both patientId and anomaly are not present then serviceList will contain ALL registered healthchecks. Else if the patientId is provided and anomaly are provided then serviceList will contain the healthcehcks for a particular patient that are anomalous in the type of measurements specified by the anomaly String. The sole anomaly String is not allowed, so if there is no patientId provided (together with the anomaly) then a 400 BadRequest response is sent to the client
      2. If after loading the healthcheck list from the specific data structure, it is empty, then it responds with a 404 Not Found and an informational body serialized in JSON
      3. If, on the other hand, the list contains at least one healthchecks, it responds with 200 OK + serialized payload in JSON
      4. If for any reason an exception is thrown, it is captured and the server responds with 500 Internal Server Error and an informational body serialized in JSON
      Since:
      1.0

    • getHealthCheckById

      @GET @Path("/{healthcheck_id}") @Timed @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getHealthCheckById(@Context javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext req, @PathParam("healthcheck_id") String healthCheckId)
      This method allows managing and responding to a GET request from a client, who wants to obtain a particular healthcheck through its healthcheckId contained in the resource's URI.
      Parameters:
      req - Dropwizard maps the incoming request into an object, which can be used within our method
      healthCheckId - it is a String representing the UUID of the healthcheck, contained in the URI as @PathParam
      Returns:
      1. If the healthcheckID is not provided, then it responds with a 400 Bad Request and an informational body serialized in JSON
      2. If after loading the healthcheck list from the specific data structure it is empty, then it responds with a 404 Not Found and an informational body serialized in JSON
      3. If, on the other hand, the list contains at least one healthcheck, it responds with 200 OK + serialized payload in JSON
      4. If for any reason an exception is thrown, it is captured and the server responds with 500 Internal Server Error and an informational body serialized in JSON
      Since:
      1.0

    • createHealthCheck

      @POST @Path("/") @Timed @Produces("application/json") @Consumes("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createHealthCheck(@Context javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext req, @Context javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo, HealthCheckCreationRequest healthCheckCreationRequest)
      This method allows managing and responding to a POST request from a client, who wants to create a new healthcheck.
      Parameters:
      req - Dropwizard maps the incoming request into an object, which can be used within our method
      uriInfo - it is the object made available by dropwizard that will allow us to reply with the absolute URI of the resource that has been created
      healthCheckCreationRequest - it is the representation of the resource in relation to the DTO
      Returns:
      1. If the request is not valid, then it responds with a 400 Bad Request and an informational body serialized in JSON
      2. After creating the healthcheck through the InventoryDataManger, it responds with 201 Created + the Location Header with the absolute URI of the created healthcheck
      3. If for any reason an exception is thrown, it is captured and the server responds with 500 Internal Server Error and an informational body serialized in JSON
      Since:
      1.0

    • updateHealthCheck

      @PUT @Path("/{healthcheck_id}") @Timed @Produces("application/json") @Consumes("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateHealthCheck(@Context javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext req, @Context javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo, @PathParam("healthcheck_id") String healthCheckId, HealthCheckUpdateRequest healthCheckUpdateRequest)
      This method allows managing and responding to a PUT request from a client, who wants to update an already existing healthcheck.
      Parameters:
      req - Dropwizard maps the incoming request into an object, which can be used within our method
      healthCheckId - it is a String representing the UUID of the healthcheck, contained in the URI as @PathParam
      healthCheckUpdateRequest - it is the representation of the resource in relation to the DTO
      Returns:
      1. If the request is not valid because healthCheckIds mismatch between the body and the URI, then it responds with a 400 Bad Request and an informational body serialized in JSON
      2. After updating healthcheck's data through the InventoryDataManger, it responds with 204 No Content
      3. If for any reason an exception is thrown, it is captured and the server responds with 500 Internal Server Error and an informational body serialized in JSON
      Since:
      1.0

    • deleteHealthCheck

      @DELETE @Path("/{healthcheck_id}") @Timed @Produces("application/json") public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteHealthCheck(@Context javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext req, @PathParam("healthcheck_id") String healthCheckId)
      This method allows managing and responding to a DELETE request from a client, who wants to delete an already existing healthcheck.
      Parameters:
      req - Dropwizard maps the incoming request into an object, which can be used within our method
      healthCheckId - it is a String representing the UUID of the healthcheck, contained in the URI as @PathParam
      Returns:
      1. If the request is not valid then it responds with a 400 Bad Request and an informational body serialized in JSON
      2. After deleting patient's data through the InventoryDataManger, it responds with 204 No Content
      3. If for any reason an exception is thrown, it is captured and the server responds with 500 Internal Server Error and an informational body serialized in JSON
      Since:
      1.0
